result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Steele was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BOTH COUNTS:  Pay costs, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect all monetary amounts at the rate of 25%.   Balance as condition of extended supervision to be paid by end of sentence or civil judgment to be entered and subject to other collection.
Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program for count one, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse program in count three.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No illegally controlled substances.

supervisions.notes: Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA  surcharge; and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.

records.addlTxt:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) no illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) seek and maintain employment. 

COURT ORDERS:
- DOC to collect all monetary amounts at the rate of 25% 
- defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the DNA surcharge if not already done.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Kenneth Steele in court with attorney Gilbert Fielding Urfer.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 30 months with 26 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 18 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 12 months; pay costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 3:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 24 months; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 12 months; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 12 months - consecutive to Count 1; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program for Count 1, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program in Count 3.

Defendant Kenneth Steele in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense needs to have further discussion with the State.  State submits a memo to the Court for sentencing purposes and moves to have it sealed.  Court grants motion and order document sealed and not to be opened unless further ordered by the Court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth Steele in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 1 & 3  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 3 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.    There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Steele in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties moves to adjourn case for further negotiations.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Steele in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties move for an adjournment for further negotiations.  Court grants motion.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Steele in court. Attorney Daniel Adams in court.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties stipulate to bond amendment, cash bond $1000.00 with no monitoring by Justice Point or electronic monitoring. Court Order Justice Point and electonic monitoring removed and approves the cash bond to be amened to $1000.00.

Attorney Gilbert F Urfer in court.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO FILE IN COURT. 
Defense requests bail modification to allow the Defendant's electronic monitoring to include leaving the home for meetings with attorney. All other conditions remain the same. 
Court grants Motion. 
Copies given to parties.

1/31/14 vf

Attorney Gilbert F Urfer in court, defendant Kenneth Steele not in court, in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Parties stipulate to a reduction in bail.  Court AMENDS bail to $1,000 cash TOT to Justice Point with the same conditions.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Kenneth Steele in court with attorney Gilbert F Urfer.  Defendant Kenneth Steele in custody.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kenneth Steele in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Kenneth Steele in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
